instruction: Describe a situation in which being detail-oriented is important.
output: Being detail-oriented is important in any situation where accuracy is of utmost importance. This could be when creating financial reports, writing technical documents, or when dealing with sensitive customer information. In these cases, small mistakes can have serious consequences, so it is critical to pay attention to even the smallest details. Being detail-oriented can also help a person spot potential problems or mistakes before they become serious issues, saving time and resources in the long run.
